parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Perfect Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Quick, swift, speedy, ready, prompt. Of uncertain affinity; fleet, i.e. prompt or ready.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Slow, slow of understanding. Of uncertain affinity; slow; figuratively, dull.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Slow, slow of understanding. Of uncertain affinity; slow; figuratively, dull.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.
